78.60: He abandoned the tabernacle at Shiloh, the tent where he resided among mankind.
78.61: He gave up his strength to captivity and his splendor to the hand of a foe.
78.62: He surrendered his people to the sword because he was enraged with his heritage.
78.63: Fire consumed his chosen young men, and his young women had no wedding songs.
78.64: His priests fell by the sword, and the widows could not lament.
78.65: The Lord awoke as if from sleep, like a warrior from the effects of wine.
78.66: He beat back his foes; he gave them lasting disgrace.
78.67: He rejected the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
78.68: He chose instead the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which he loved.
78.69: He built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever.
78.70: He chose David his servant and took him from the sheep pens;
78.71: he brought him from tending ewes to be shepherd over his people Jacob — over Israel, his inheritance.
78.72: He shepherded them with a pure heart and guided them with his skillful hands.

79.1: A psalm of Asaph. † God, the nations have invaded your inheritance, desecrated your holy temple, and turned Jerusalem into ruins.
79.2: They gave the corpses of your servants to the birds of the sky for food, the flesh of your faithful ones to the beasts of the earth.
79.3: They poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them.
79.4: We have become an object of reproach to our neighbors, a source of mockery and ridicule to those around us.
79.5: How long, LORD? Will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy keep burning like fire?
79.6: Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t acknowledge you, on the kingdoms that don’t call on your name,
79.7: for they have devoured Jacob and devastated his homeland.
79.8: Do not hold past iniquities against us; let your compassion come to us quickly, for we have become very weak.
79.9: God of our salvation, help us, for the glory of your name. Rescue us and atone for our sins, for your name’s sake.
79.10: Why should the nations ask, “Where is their God? ” Before our eyes, let vengeance for the shed blood of your servants be known among the nations.
79.11: Let the groans of the prisoners reach you; according to your great power, preserve those condemned to die.
79.12: Pay back sevenfold to our neighbors the reproach they have hurled at you, Lord.
79.13: Then we, your people, the sheep of your pasture, will thank you forever; we will declare your praise to generation after generation.

80.1: For the choir director: according to “The Lilies.” † A testimony of Asaph. † A psalm. Listen, Shepherd of Israel, who leads Joseph like a flock; you who sit enthroned between the cherubim, shine
80.2: on Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. Rally your power and come to save us.
80.3: Restore us, God; make your face shine on us, so that we may be saved.
80.4: LORD God of Armies, how long will you be angry with your people’s prayers?
80.5: You fed them the bread of tears and gave them a full measure of tears to drink.
80.6: You put us at odds with our neighbors; our enemies mock us.
80.7: Restore us, God of Armies; make your face shine on us, so that we may be saved.
80.8: You dug up a vine from Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it.
80.9: You cleared a place for it; it took root and filled the land.
80.10: The mountains were covered by its shade, and the mighty cedars with its branches.
80.11: It sent out sprouts toward the Sea and shoots toward the River.
80.12: Why have you broken down its walls so that all who pass by pick its fruit?
80.13: Boars from the forest tear at it and creatures of the field feed on it.
80.14: Return, God of Armies. Look down from heaven and see; take care of this vine,
80.15: the root your right hand planted, the son that you made strong for yourself.
80.16: It was cut down and burned; they perish at the rebuke of your countenance.
80.17: Let your hand be with the man at your right hand, with the son of man you have made strong for yourself.
80.18: Then we will not turn away from you; revive us, and we will call on your name.
80.19: Restore us, LORD, God of Armies; make your face shine on us, so that we may be saved.

81.1: For the choir director: on the Gittith. Of Asaph. † Sing for joy to God our strength; shout in triumph to the God of Jacob.
81.2: Lift up a song—play the tambourine, the melodious lyre, and the harp.
81.3: Blow the ram’s horn on the day of our feasts during the new moon and during the full moon.
81.4: For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
81.5: He set it up as a decree for Joseph when he went throughout the land of Egypt. I heard an unfamiliar language:
81.6: “I relieved his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from carrying the basket.
81.7: You called out in distress, and I rescued you; I answered you from the thundercloud. I tested you at the Waters of Meribah. Selah
81.8: Listen, my people, and I will admonish you. Israel, if you would only listen to me!
81.9: There must not be a strange god among you; you must not bow down to a foreign god.
81.10: I am the LORD your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
81.12: So I gave them over to their stubborn hearts to follow their own plans.
81.13: If only my people would listen to me and Israel would follow my ways,
81.14: I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.”
81.15: Those who hate the LORD would cower to him; their doom would last forever.
81.16: But he would feed Israel with the best wheat. “I would satisfy you with honey from the rock.”

82.1: A psalm of Asaph. † God stands in the divine assembly; he pronounces judgment among the gods:
82.2: “How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah
82.3: Provide justice for the needy and the fatherless; uphold the rights of the oppressed and the destitute.
82.4: Rescue the poor and needy; save them from the power of the wicked.”
82.5: They do not know or understand; they wander in darkness. All the foundations of the earth are shaken.
82.6: I said, “You are gods; you are all sons of the Most High.
82.7: However, you will die like humans and fall like any other ruler.”
82.8: Rise up, God, judge the earth, for all the nations belong to you.

83.1: A song. A psalm of Asaph. † God, do not keep silent. Do not be deaf, God; do not be quiet.
83.2: See how your enemies make an uproar; those who hate you have acted arrogantly.
83.3: They devise clever schemes against your people; they conspire against your treasured ones.
83.5: For they have conspired with one mind; they form an alliance against you —
83.6: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,
83.7: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre.
83.8: Even Assyria has joined them; they lend support to the sons of Lot. Selah
83.9: Deal with them as you did with Midian, as you did with Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River.
83.10: They were destroyed at En-dor; they became manure for the ground.
83.11: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their tribal leaders like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12: who said, “Let’s seize God’s pastures for ourselves.”
83.13: Make them like tumbleweed, my God, like straw before the wind.
83.14: As fire burns a forest, as a flame blazes through mountains,
83.15: so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your storm.
83.16: Cover their faces with shame so that they will seek your name, LORD.
83.17: Let them be put to shame and terrified forever; let them perish in disgrace.
83.18: May they know that you alone — whose name is the LORD — are the Most High over the whole earth.

84.1: For the choir director: on the Gittith. † A psalm of the sons of Korah. How lovely is your dwelling place, LORD of Armies.
84.2: I long and yearn for the courts of the LORD; my heart and flesh cry out for the living God.
84.3: Even a sparrow finds a home, and a swallow, a nest for herself where she places her young — near your altars, LORD of Armies, my King and my God.
84.4: How happy are those who reside in your house, who praise you continually. Selah
84.5: Happy are the people whose strength is in you, whose hearts are set on pilgrimage.
84.6: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a source of spring water; even the autumn rain will cover it with blessings.
84.7: They go from strength to strength; each appears before God in Zion.
84.8: LORD God of Armies, hear my prayer; listen, God of Jacob. Selah
84.9: Consider our shield, God; look on the face of your anointed one.
84.10: Better a day in your courts than a thousand anywhere else. I would rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God than live in the tents of wicked people.
84.11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield. The LORD grants favor and honor; he does not withhold the good from those who live with integrity.
84.12: Happy is the person who trusts in you, LORD of Armies!

85.1: For the choir director. A psalm of the sons of Korah. LORD, you showed favor to your land; you restored the fortunes of Jacob.
85.2: You forgave your people’s guilt; you covered all their sin. Selah
85.3: You withdrew all your fury; you turned from your burning anger.
85.4: Return to us, God of our salvation, and abandon your displeasure with us.
85.5: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you prolong your anger for all generations?
85.6: Will you not revive us again so that your people may rejoice in you?
85.7: Show us your faithful love, LORD, and give us your salvation.
85.8: I will listen to what God will say; surely the LORD will declare peace to his people, his faithful ones, and not let them go back to foolish ways.
85.9: His salvation is very near those who fear him, so that glory may dwell in our land.
85.10: Faithful love and truth will join together; righteousness and peace will embrace.
85.11: Truth will spring up from the earth, and righteousness will look down from heaven.
85.12: Also, the LORD will provide what is good, and our land will yield its crops.
85.13: Righteousness will go before him to prepare the way for his steps.

86.1: A prayer of David. Listen, LORD, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.
86.2: Protect my life, for I am faithful. You are my God; save your servant who trusts in you.
86.3: Be gracious to me, Lord, for I call to you all day long.
86.4: Bring joy to your servant’s life, because I appeal to you, Lord.
86.5: For you, Lord, are kind and ready to forgive, abounding in faithful love to all who call on you.
86.6: LORD, hear my prayer; listen to my cries for mercy.
86.7: I call on you in the day of my distress, for you will answer me.
86.8: Lord, there is no one like you among the gods, and there are no works like yours.
86.9: All the nations you have made will come and bow down before you, Lord, and will honor your name.
86.10: For you are great and perform wonders; you alone are God.
86.11: Teach me your way, LORD, and I will live by your truth. Give me an undivided mind to fear your name.
86.12: I will praise you with all my heart, Lord my God, and will honor your name forever.
86.13: For your faithful love for me is great, and you rescue my life from the depths of Sheol.
86.14: God, arrogant people have attacked me; a gang of ruthless men intends to kill me. They do not let you guide them.
86.15: But you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger and abounding in faithful love and truth.
86.16: Turn to me and be gracious to me. Give your strength to your servant; save the son of your female servant.
86.17: Show me a sign of your goodness; my enemies will see and be put to shame because you, LORD, have helped and comforted me.

87.1: A psalm of the sons of Korah. A song. The city he founded is on the holy mountains.
87.2: The LORD loves Zion’s city gates more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
87.3: Glorious things are said about you, city of God. Selah
87.4: “I will make a record of those who know me: Rahab, Babylon, Philistia, Tyre, and Cush — each one was born there.”
87.5: And it will be said of Zion, “This one and that one were born in her.” The Most High himself will establish her.
87.6: When he registers the peoples, the LORD will record, “This one was born there.” Selah

88.1: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director: according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite. † LORD, God of my salvation, I cry out before you day and night.
88.2: May my prayer reach your presence; listen to my cry.
88.3: For I have had enough troubles, and my life is near Sheol.
88.4: I am counted among those going down to the Pit. I am like a man without strength,
88.5: abandoned among the dead. I am like the slain lying in the grave, whom you no longer remember, and who are cut off from your care.
88.6: You have put me in the lowest part of the Pit, in the darkest places, in the depths.
88.7: Your wrath weighs heavily on me; you have overwhelmed me with all your waves. Selah
88.8: You have distanced my friends from me; you have made me repulsive to them. I am shut in and cannot go out.
88.9: My eyes are worn out from crying. LORD, I cry out to you all day long; I spread out my hands to you.
88.10: Do you work wonders for the dead? Do departed spirits rise up to praise you? Selah
88.11: Will your faithful love be declared in the grave, your faithfulness in Abaddon?
88.12: Will your wonders be known in the darkness or your righteousness in the land of oblivion?
88.13: But I call to you for help, LORD; in the morning my prayer meets you.
88.14: LORD, why do you reject me? Why do you hide your face from me?
88.15: From my youth, I have been suffering and near death. I suffer your horrors; I am desperate.
88.16: Your wrath sweeps over me; your terrors destroy me.
88.17: They surround me like water all day long; they close in on me from every side.
88.18: You have distanced loved one and neighbor from me; darkness is my only friend.

89.1: A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite. † I will sing about the LORD’s faithful love forever; I will proclaim your faithfulness to all generations with my mouth.
89.2: For I will declare, “Faithful love is built up forever; you establish your faithfulness in the heavens.”
89.3: The LORD said, “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; I have sworn an oath to David my servant:
89.4: ‘I will establish your offspring forever and build up your throne for all generations.’ ” Selah
89.5: LORD, the heavens praise your wonders — your faithfulness also — in the assembly of the holy ones.
89.6: For who in the skies can compare with the LORD? Who among the heavenly beings is like the LORD?
89.7: God is greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, more awe-inspiring than all who surround him.
89.8: LORD God of Armies, who is strong like you, LORD? Your faithfulness surrounds you.
89.9: You rule the raging sea; when its waves surge, you still them.
89.10: You crushed Rahab like one who is slain; you scattered your enemies with your powerful arm.
89.11: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours. The world and everything in it—you founded them.
89.12: North and south—you created them. Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at your name.
89.13: You have a mighty arm; your hand is powerful; your right hand is lifted high.
89.14: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; faithful love and truth go before you.
89.15: Happy are the people who know the joyful shout; LORD, they walk in the light from your face.
89.16: They rejoice in your name all day long, and they are exalted by your righteousness.
89.17: For you are their magnificent strength; by your favor our horn is exalted.
89.18: Surely our shield belongs to the LORD, our king to the Holy One of Israel.
89.19: You once spoke in a vision to your faithful ones and said, “I have granted help to a warrior; I have exalted one chosen from the people.
89.20: I have found David my servant; I have anointed him with my sacred oil.
89.21: My hand will always be with him, and my arm will strengthen him.
89.22: The enemy will not oppress him; the wicked will not afflict him.
89.23: I will crush his foes before him and strike those who hate him.
89.24: My faithfulness and love will be with him, and through my name his horn will be exalted.
89.25: I will extend his power to the sea and his right hand to the rivers.
89.26: He will call to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, the rock of my salvation.’
89.27: I will also make him my firstborn, greatest of the kings of the earth.
89.28: I will always preserve my faithful love for him, and my covenant with him will endure.
89.29: I will establish his line forever, his throne as long as heaven lasts.
89.30: If his sons abandon my instruction and do not live by my ordinances,
89.31: if they dishonor my statutes and do not keep my commands,
89.32: then I will call their rebellion to account with the rod, their iniquity with blows.
89.33: But I will not withdraw my faithful love from him or betray my faithfulness.
89.34: I will not violate my covenant or change what my lips have said.
89.35: Once and for all I have sworn an oath by my holiness; I will not lie to David.
89.36: His offspring will continue forever, his throne like the sun before me,
89.37: like the moon, established forever, a faithful witness in the sky.” Selah
89.38: But you have spurned and rejected him; you have become enraged with your anointed.
89.39: You have repudiated the covenant with your servant; you have completely dishonored his crown.
89.40: You have broken down all his walls; you have reduced his fortified cities to ruins.
89.41: All who pass by plunder him; he has become an object of ridicule to his neighbors.
89.42: You have lifted high the right hand of his foes; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
89.43: You have also turned back his sharp sword and have not let him stand in battle.
89.44: You have made his splendor cease and have overturned his throne.
89.45: You have shortened the days of his youth; you have covered him with shame. Selah
89.46: How long, LORD? Will you hide forever? Will your anger keep burning like fire?
89.47: Remember how short my life is. Have you created everyone for nothing?
89.48: What courageous person can live and never see death? Who can save himself from the power of Sheol? Selah
89.49: Lord, where are the former acts of your faithful love that you swore to David in your faithfulness?
89.50: Remember, Lord, the ridicule against your servants — in my heart I carry abuse from all the peoples —
89.51: how your enemies have ridiculed, LORD, how they have ridiculed every step of your anointed.
89.52: Blessed be the LORD forever. Amen and amen.

90.1: A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, you have been our refuge in every generation.
90.2: Before the mountains were born, before you gave birth to the earth and the world, from eternity to eternity, you are God.
90.3: You return mankind to the dust, saying, “Return, descendants of Adam.”
90.4: For in your sight a thousand years are like yesterday that passes by, like a few hours of the night.
90.5: You end their lives; they sleep. They are like grass that grows in the morning —
90.6: in the morning it sprouts and grows; by evening it withers and dries up.
90.7: For we are consumed by your anger; we are terrified by your wrath.
90.8: You have set our iniquities before you, our secret sins in the light of your presence.
90.9: For all our days ebb away under your wrath; we end our years like a sigh.
90.10: Our lives last seventy years or, if we are strong, eighty years. Even the best of them are struggle and sorrow; indeed, they pass quickly and we fly away.
90.11: Who understands the power of your anger? Your wrath matches the fear that is due you.
90.12: Teach us to number our days carefully so that we may develop wisdom in our hearts.
90.13: LORD—how long? Turn and have compassion on your servants.
90.14: Satisfy us in the morning with your faithful love so that we may shout with joy and be glad all our days.
90.15: Make us rejoice for as many days as you have humbled us, for as many years as we have seen adversity.
90.16: Let your work be seen by your servants, and your splendor by their children.
90.17: Let the favor of the Lord our God be on us; establish for us the work of our hands — establish the work of our hands!

91.1: The one who lives under the protection of the Most High dwells in the shadow of the Almighty.
91.2: I will say concerning the LORD, who is my refuge and my fortress, my God in whom I trust:
91.3: He himself will rescue you from the bird trap, from the destructive plague.
91.4: He will cover you with his feathers; you will take refuge under his wings. His faithfulness will be a protective shield.
91.5: You will not fear the terror of the night, the arrow that flies by day,
91.6: the plague that stalks in darkness, or the pestilence that ravages at noon.
91.7: Though a thousand fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, the pestilence will not reach you.
91.8: You will only see it with your eyes and witness the punishment of the wicked.
91.9: Because you have made the LORD—my refuge, the Most High—your dwelling place,
91.10: no harm will come to you; no plague will come near your tent.
91.11: For he will give his angels orders concerning you, to protect you in all your ways.
91.12: They will support you with their hands so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
91.13: You will tread on the lion and the cobra; you will trample the young lion and the serpent.
91.15: When he calls out to me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble. I will rescue him and give him honor.
91.16: I will satisfy him with a long life and show him my salvation.

92.1: A psalm. A song for the Sabbath day. It is good to give thanks to the LORD, to sing praise to your name, Most High,
92.2: to declare your faithful love in the morning and your faithfulness at night,
92.3: with a ten-stringed harp and the music of a lyre.
92.4: For you have made me rejoice, LORD, by what you have done; I will shout for joy because of the works of your hands.
92.5: How magnificent are your works, LORD, how profound your thoughts!
92.6: A stupid person does not know, a fool does not understand this:
92.7: though the wicked sprout like grass and all evildoers flourish, they will be eternally destroyed.
92.8: But you, LORD, are exalted forever.
92.9: For indeed, LORD, your enemies — indeed, your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.
92.10: You have lifted up my horn like that of a wild ox; I have been anointed with the finest oil.
92.11: My eyes look at my enemies; when evildoers rise against me, my ears hear them.
92.12: The righteous thrive like a palm tree and grow like a cedar tree in Lebanon.
92.13: Planted in the house of the LORD, they thrive in the courts of our God.
92.14: They will still bear fruit in old age, healthy and green,
92.15: to declare, “The LORD is just; he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.”

93.1: The LORD reigns! He is robed in majesty; the LORD is robed, enveloped in strength. The world is firmly established; it cannot be shaken.
93.2: Your throne has been established from the beginning; you are from eternity.
93.3: The floods have lifted up, LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their pounding waves.
93.4: Greater than the roar of a huge torrent — the mighty breakers of the sea — the LORD on high is majestic.
93.5: LORD, your testimonies are completely reliable; holiness adorns your house for all the days to come.

94.1: LORD, God of vengeance — God of vengeance, shine!
94.2: Rise up, Judge of the earth; repay the proud what they deserve.
94.3: LORD, how long will the wicked — how long will the wicked celebrate?
94.4: They pour out arrogant words; all the evildoers boast.
94.5: LORD, they crush your people; they oppress your heritage.
94.6: They kill the widow and the resident alien and murder the fatherless.
94.7: They say, “The LORD doesn’t see it. The God of Jacob doesn’t pay attention.”
94.8: Pay attention, you stupid people! Fools, when will you be wise?
94.9: Can the one who shaped the ear not hear, the one who formed the eye not see?
94.10: The one who instructs nations, the one who teaches mankind knowledge — does he not discipline?
94.11: The LORD knows the thoughts of mankind; they are futile.
94.12: LORD, how happy is anyone you discipline and teach from your law
94.13: to give him relief from troubled times until a pit is dug for the wicked.
94.14: The LORD will not leave his people or abandon his heritage,
94.15: for the administration of justice will again be righteous, and all the upright in heart will follow it.
94.16: Who stands up for me against the wicked? Who takes a stand for me against evildoers?
94.17: If the LORD had not been my helper, I would soon rest in the silence of death.
94.18: If I say, “My foot is slipping,” your faithful love will support me, LORD.
94.19: When I am filled with cares, your comfort brings me joy.
94.20: Can a corrupt throne be your ally, a throne that makes evil laws?
94.21: They band together against the life of the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
94.22: But the LORD is my refuge; my God is the rock of my protection.
94.23: He will pay them back for their sins and destroy them for their evil. The LORD our God will destroy them.

95.1: Come, let’s shout joyfully to the LORD, shout triumphantly to the rock of our salvation!
95.2: Let’s enter his presence with thanksgiving; let’s shout triumphantly to him in song.
95.3: For the LORD is a great God, a great King above all gods.
95.4: The depths of the earth are in his hand, and the mountain peaks are his.
95.5: The sea is his; he made it. His hands formed the dry land.
95.6: Come, let’s worship and bow down; let’s kneel before the LORD our Maker.
95.7: For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture, the sheep under his care. Today, if you hear his voice:
95.8: Do not harden your hearts as at Meribah, as on that day at Massah in the wilderness
95.9: where your ancestors tested me; they tried me, though they had seen what I did.
95.10: For forty years I was disgusted with that generation; I said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray; they do not know my ways.”
95.11: So I swore in my anger, “They will not enter my rest.”

96.1: Sing a new song to the LORD; let the whole earth sing to the LORD.
96.2: Sing to the LORD, bless his name; proclaim his salvation from day to day.
96.3: Declare his glory among the nations, his wondrous works among all peoples.
96.4: For the LORD is great and is highly praised; he is feared above all gods.
96.5: For all the gods of the peoples are worthless idols, but the LORD made the heavens.
96.6: Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
96.7: Ascribe to the LORD, you families of the peoples, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
96.8: Ascribe to the LORD the glory of his name; bring an offering and enter his courts.
96.9: Worship the LORD in the splendor of his holiness; let the whole earth tremble before him.
96.10: Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns. The world is firmly established; it cannot be shaken. He judges the peoples fairly.”
96.11: Let the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice; let the sea and all that fills it resound.
96.12: Let the fields and everything in them celebrate. Then all the trees of the forest will shout for joy
96.13: before the LORD, for he is coming — for he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his faithfulness.

97.1: The LORD reigns! Let the earth rejoice; let the many coasts and islands be glad.
97.2: Clouds and total darkness surround him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
97.3: Fire goes before him and burns up his foes on every side.
97.4: His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.
97.5: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD — at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97.6: The heavens proclaim his righteousness; all the peoples see his glory.
97.7: All who serve carved images, those who boast in worthless idols, will be put to shame. All the gods must worship him.
97.8: Zion hears and is glad, Judah’s villages rejoice because of your judgments, LORD.
97.9: For you, LORD, are the Most High over the whole earth; you are exalted above all the gods.
97.10: You who love the LORD, hate evil! He protects the lives of his faithful ones; he rescues them from the power of the wicked.
97.11: Light dawns for the righteous, gladness for the upright in heart.
97.12: Be glad in the LORD, you righteous ones, and give thanks to his holy name.

98.1: A psalm. Sing a new song to the LORD, for he has performed wonders; his right hand and holy arm have won him victory.
98.2: The LORD has made his victory known; he has revealed his righteousness in the sight of the nations.
98.3: He has remembered his love and faithfulness to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen our God’s victory.
98.4: Let the whole earth shout to the LORD; be jubilant, shout for joy, and sing.
98.5: Sing to the LORD with the lyre, with the lyre and melodious song.
98.6: With trumpets and the blast of the ram’s horn shout triumphantly in the presence of the LORD, our King.
98.7: Let the sea and all that fills it, the world and those who live in it, resound.
98.8: Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains shout together for joy
98.9: before the LORD, for he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world righteously and the peoples fairly.

99.1: The LORD reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He is enthroned between the cherubim. Let the earth quake.
99.2: The LORD is great in Zion; he is exalted above all the peoples.
99.3: Let them praise your great and awe-inspiring name. He is holy.
99.4: The mighty King loves justice. You have established fairness; you have administered justice and righteousness in Jacob.
99.5: Exalt the LORD our God; bow in worship at his footstool. He is holy.
99.6: Moses and Aaron were among his priests; Samuel also was among those calling on his name. They called to the LORD and he answered them.
99.7: He spoke to them in a pillar of cloud; they kept his decrees and the statutes he gave them.
99.8: LORD our God, you answered them. You were a forgiving God to them, but an avenger of their sinful actions.
99.9: Exalt the LORD our God; bow in worship at his holy mountain, for the LORD our God is holy.

100.1: A psalm of thanksgiving. Let the whole earth shout triumphantly to the LORD!
100.2: Serve the LORD with gladness; come before him with joyful songs.
100.3: Acknowledge that the LORD is God. He made us, and we are his — his people, the sheep of his pasture.
100.4: Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise. Give thanks to him and bless his name.
100.5: For the LORD is good, and his faithful love endures forever; his faithfulness, through all generations.

101.1: A psalm of David. I will sing of faithful love and justice; I will sing praise to you, LORD.
101.2: I will pay attention to the way of integrity. When will you come to me? I will live with a heart of integrity in my house.
101.3: I will not let anything worthless guide me. I hate the practice of transgression; it will not cling to me.
101.4: A devious heart will be far from me; I will not be involved with evil.
101.5: I will destroy anyone who secretly slanders his neighbor; I cannot tolerate anyone with haughty eyes or an arrogant heart.
101.6: My eyes favor the faithful of the land so that they may sit down with me. The one who follows the way of integrity may serve me.
101.7: No one who acts deceitfully will live in my palace; the one who tells lies will not be retained here to guide me.
101.8: Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land, wiping out all evildoers from the LORD’s city.

102.1: A prayer of a suffering person who is weak and pours out his lament before the L ord. † LORD, hear my prayer; let my cry for help come before you.
102.2: Do not hide your face from me in my day of trouble. Listen closely to me; answer me quickly when I call.
102.3: For my days vanish like smoke, and my bones burn like a furnace.
102.4: My heart is suffering, withered like grass; I even forget to eat my food.
102.5: Because of the sound of my groaning, my flesh sticks to my bones.
102.6: I am like an eagle owl, like a little owl among the ruins.
102.7: I stay awake; I am like a solitary bird on a roof.
102.8: My enemies taunt me all day long; they ridicule and use my name as a curse.
102.9: I eat ashes like bread and mingle my drinks with tears
102.10: because of your indignation and wrath; for you have picked me up and thrown me aside.
102.11: My days are like a lengthening shadow, and I wither away like grass.
102.12: But you, LORD, are enthroned forever; your fame endures to all generations.
102.13: You will rise up and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her — the appointed time has come.
102.14: For your servants take delight in its stones and favor its dust.
102.15: Then the nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth your glory,
102.16: for the LORD will rebuild Zion; he will appear in his glory.
102.17: He will pay attention to the prayer of the destitute and will not despise their prayer.
102.18: This will be written for a later generation, and a people who have not yet been created will praise the LORD:
102.19: He looked down from his holy heights — the LORD gazed out from heaven to earth —
102.20: to hear a prisoner’s groaning, to set free those condemned to die,
102.21: so that they might declare the name of the LORD in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem
102.22: when peoples and kingdoms are assembled to serve the LORD.
102.23: He has broken my strength in midcourse; he has shortened my days.
102.24: I say, “My God, do not take me in the middle of my life! Your years continue through all generations.
102.25: Long ago you established the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.
102.26: They will perish, but you will endure; all of them will wear out like clothing. You will change them like a garment, and they will pass away.
102.27: But you are the same, and your years will never end.
102.28: Your servants’ children will dwell securely, and their offspring will be established before you.”

103.1: Of David. My soul, bless the LORD, and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
103.2: My soul, bless the LORD, and do not forget all his benefits.
103.3: He forgives all your iniquity; he heals all your diseases.
103.4: He redeems your life from the Pit; he crowns you with faithful love and compassion.
103.5: He satisfies you with good things; your youth is renewed like the eagle.
103.6: The LORD executes acts of righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
103.7: He revealed his ways to Moses, his deeds to the people of Israel.
103.8: The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in faithful love.
103.9: He will not always accuse us or be angry forever.
103.10: He has not dealt with us as our sins deserve or repaid us according to our iniquities.
103.11: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is his faithful love toward those who fear him.
103.12: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
103.13: As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear him.
103.14: For he knows what we are made of, remembering that we are dust.
103.15: As for man, his days are like grass — he blooms like a flower of the field;
103.16: when the wind passes over it, it vanishes, and its place is no longer known.
103.17: But from eternity to eternity the LORD’s faithful love is toward those who fear him, and his righteousness toward the grandchildren
103.18: of those who keep his covenant, who remember to observe his precepts.
103.19: The LORD has established his throne in heaven, and his kingdom rules over all.
103.20: Bless the LORD, all his angels of great strength, who do his word, obedient to his command.
103.21: Bless the LORD, all his armies, his servants who do his will.
103.22: Bless the LORD, all his works in all the places where he rules. My soul, bless the LORD!

104.1: My soul, bless the LORD! LORD my God, you are very great; you are clothed with majesty and splendor.
104.2: He wraps himself in light as if it were a robe, spreading out the sky like a canopy,
104.3: laying the beams of his palace on the waters above, making the clouds his chariot, walking on the wings of the wind,
104.4: and making the winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.
104.5: He established the earth on its foundations; it will never be shaken.
104.6: You covered it with the deep as if it were a garment; the water stood above the mountains.
104.7: At your rebuke the water fled; at the sound of your thunder they hurried away —
104.8: mountains rose and valleys sank — to the place you established for them.
104.9: You set a boundary they cannot cross; they will never cover the earth again.
104.10: He causes the springs to gush into the valleys; they flow between the mountains.
104.11: They supply water for every wild beast; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12: The birds of the sky live beside the springs; they make their voices heard among the foliage.
104.13: He waters the mountains from his palace; the earth is satisfied by the fruit of your labor.
104.14: He causes grass to grow for the livestock and provides crops for man to cultivate, producing food from the earth,
104.15: wine that makes human hearts glad — making his face shine with oil — and bread that sustains human hearts.
104.16: The trees of the LORD flourish, the cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
104.17: There the birds make their nests; storks make their homes in the pine trees.
104.18: The high mountains are for the wild goats; the cliffs are a refuge for hyraxes.
104.19: He made the moon to mark the festivals; the sun knows when to set.
104.20: You bring darkness, and it becomes night, when all the forest animals stir.
104.21: The young lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.
104.22: The sun rises; they go back and lie down in their dens.
104.23: Man goes out to his work and to his labor until evening.
104.24: How countless are your works, LORD! In wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.
104.25: Here is the sea, vast and wide, teeming with creatures beyond number — living things both large and small.
104.26: There the ships move about, and Leviathan, which you formed to play there.
104.27: All of them wait for you to give them their food at the right time.
104.28: When you give it to them, they gather it; when you open your hand, they are satisfied with good things.
104.29: When you hide your face, they are terrified; when you take away their breath, they die and return to the dust.
104.30: When you send your breath, they are created, and you renew the surface of the ground.
104.31: May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in his works.
104.32: He looks at the earth, and it trembles; he touches the mountains, and they pour out smoke.
104.33: I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God while I live.
104.34: May my meditation be pleasing to him; I will rejoice in the LORD.
104.35: May sinners vanish from the earth and wicked people be no more. My soul, bless the LORD! Hallelujah!

105.1: Give thanks to the LORD, call on his name; proclaim his deeds among the peoples.
105.2: Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell about all his wondrous works!
105.3: Boast in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
105.4: Seek the LORD and his strength; seek his face always.
105.5: Remember the wondrous works he has done, his wonders, and the judgments he has pronounced,
105.6: you offspring of Abraham his servant, Jacob’s descendants—his chosen ones.
105.7: He is the LORD our God; his judgments govern the whole earth.
105.8: He remembers his covenant forever, the promise he ordained for a thousand generations —
105.9: the covenant he made with Abraham, swore to Isaac,
105.10: and confirmed to Jacob as a decree and to Israel as a permanent covenant:
105.11: “I will give the land of Canaan to you as your inherited portion.”
105.12: When they were few in number, very few indeed, and resident aliens in Canaan,
105.13: wandering from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another,
105.14: he allowed no one to oppress them; he rebuked kings on their behalf:
105.16: He called down famine against the land and destroyed the entire food supply.
105.17: He had sent a man ahead of them — Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.18: They hurt his feet with shackles; his neck was put in an iron collar.
105.19: Until the time his prediction came true, the word of the LORD tested him.
105.20: The king sent for him and released him; the ruler of peoples set him free.
105.21: He made him master of his household, ruler over all his possessions —
105.22: binding his officials at will and instructing his elders.
105.23: Then Israel went to Egypt; Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
105.24: The LORD made his people very fruitful; he made them more numerous than their foes,
105.25: whose hearts he turned to hate his people and to deal deceptively with his servants.
105.26: He sent Moses his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
105.27: They performed his miraculous signs among them and wonders in the land of Ham.
105.28: He sent darkness, and it became dark — for did they not defy his commands?
105.29: He turned their water into blood and caused their fish to die.
105.30: Their land was overrun with frogs, even in their royal chambers.
105.31: He spoke, and insects came — gnats throughout their country.
105.32: He gave them hail for rain, and lightning throughout their land.
105.33: He struck their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their territory.
105.34: He spoke, and locusts came — young locusts without number.
105.35: They devoured all the vegetation in their land and consumed the produce of their land.
105.36: He struck all the firstborn in their land, all their first progeny.
105.37: Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold, and no one among his tribes stumbled.
105.38: Egypt was glad when they left, for the dread of Israel had fallen on them.
105.39: He spread a cloud as a covering and gave a fire to light up the night.
105.40: They asked, and he brought quail and satisfied them with bread from heaven.
105.41: He opened a rock, and water gushed out; it flowed like a stream in the desert.
105.42: For he remembered his holy promise to Abraham his servant.
105.43: He brought his people out with rejoicing, his chosen ones with shouts of joy.
105.44: He gave them the lands of the nations, and they inherited what other peoples had worked for.
105.45: All this happened so that they might keep his statutes and obey his instructions. Hallelujah!

106.1: Hallelujah! Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his faithful love endures forever.
106.2: Who can declare the LORD’s mighty acts or proclaim all the praise due him?
106.3: How happy are those who uphold justice, who practice righteousness at all times.
106.4: Remember me, LORD, when you show favor to your people. Come to me with your salvation
106.5: so that I may enjoy the prosperity of your chosen ones, rejoice in the joy of your nation, and boast about your heritage.
106.6: Both we and our ancestors have sinned; we have done wrong and have acted wickedly.
106.7: Our ancestors in Egypt did not grasp the significance of your wondrous works or remember your many acts of faithful love; instead, they rebelled by the sea—the Red Sea.
106.8: Yet he saved them for his name’s sake, to make his power known.
106.9: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; he led them through the depths as through a desert.
106.10: He saved them from the power of the adversary; he redeemed them from the power of the enemy.
106.11: Water covered their foes; not one of them remained.
106.12: Then they believed his promises and sang his praise.
106.13: They soon forgot his works and would not wait for his counsel.
106.14: They were seized with craving in the wilderness and tested God in the desert.
106.15: He gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease among them.
106.16: In the camp they were envious of Moses and of Aaron, the LORD’s holy one.
106.17: The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it covered the assembly of Abiram.
106.18: Fire blazed throughout their assembly; flames consumed the wicked.
106.19: At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped the cast metal image.
106.20: They exchanged their glory for the image of a grass-eating ox.
106.21: They forgot God their Savior, who did great things in Egypt,
106.22: wondrous works in the land of Ham, awe-inspiring acts at the Red Sea.
106.23: So he said he would have destroyed them — if Moses his chosen one had not stood before him in the breach to turn his wrath away from destroying them.
106.24: They despised the pleasant land and did not believe his promise.
106.25: They grumbled in their tents and did not listen to the LORD.
106.26: So he raised his hand against them with an oath that he would make them fall in the desert
106.27: and would disperse their descendants among the nations, scattering them throughout the lands.
106.28: They aligned themselves with Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods.
106.29: They angered the LORD with their deeds, and a plague broke out against them.
106.30: But Phinehas stood up and intervened, and the plague was stopped.
106.31: It was credited to him as righteousness throughout all generations to come.
106.32: They angered the LORD at the Waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered because of them,
106.33: for they embittered his spirit, and he spoke rashly with his lips.
106.34: They did not destroy the peoples as the LORD had commanded them
106.35: but mingled with the nations and adopted their ways.
106.36: They served their idols, which became a snare to them.
106.37: They sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
106.38: They shed innocent blood — the blood of their sons and daughters whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; so the land became polluted with blood.
106.39: They defiled themselves by their actions and prostituted themselves by their deeds.
106.40: Therefore the LORD’s anger burned against his people, and he abhorred his own inheritance.
106.41: He handed them over to the nations; those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42: Their enemies oppressed them, and they were subdued under their power.
106.43: He rescued them many times, but they continued to rebel deliberately and were beaten down by their iniquity.
106.44: When he heard their cry, he took note of their distress,
106.45: remembered his covenant with them, and relented according to the abundance of his faithful love.
106.46: He caused them to be pitied before all their captors.
106.47: Save us, LORD our God, and gather us from the nations, so that we may give thanks to your holy name and rejoice in your praise.

107.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his faithful love endures forever.
107.2: Let the redeemed of the LORD proclaim that he has redeemed them from the power of the foe
107.3: and has gathered them from the lands — from the east and the west, from the north and the south.
107.4: Some wandered in the desolate wilderness, finding no way to a city where they could live.
107.5: They were hungry and thirsty; their spirits failed within them.
107.6: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; he rescued them from their distress.
107.7: He led them by the right path to go to a city where they could live.
107.8: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love and his wondrous works for all humanity.
107.9: For he has satisfied the thirsty and filled the hungry with good things.
107.10: Others sat in darkness and gloom — prisoners in cruel chains —
107.11: because they rebelled against God’s commands and despised the counsel of the Most High.
107.12: He broke their spirits with hard labor; they stumbled, and there was no one to help.
107.13: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; he saved them from their distress.
107.14: He brought them out of darkness and gloom and broke their chains apart.
107.15: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love and his wondrous works for all humanity.
107.16: For he has broken down the bronze gates and cut through the iron bars.
107.17: Fools suffered affliction because of their rebellious ways and their iniquities.
107.18: They loathed all food and came near the gates of death.
107.19: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble; he saved them from their distress.
107.20: He sent his word and healed them; he rescued them from their traps.
107.21: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love and his wondrous works for all humanity.
107.22: Let them offer thanksgiving sacrifices and announce his works with shouts of joy.
107.23: Others went to sea in ships, conducting trade on the vast water.
107.24: They saw the LORD’s works, his wondrous works in the deep.
107.25: He spoke and raised a stormy wind that stirred up the waves of the sea.
107.26: Rising up to the sky, sinking down to the depths, their courage melting away in anguish,
107.27: they reeled and staggered like a drunkard, and all their skill was useless.
107.28: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.
107.29: He stilled the storm to a whisper, and the waves of the sea were hushed.
107.30: They rejoiced when the waves grew quiet. Then he guided them to the harbor they longed for.
107.31: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love and his wondrous works for all humanity.
107.32: Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.
107.33: He turns rivers into desert, springs into thirsty ground,
107.34: and fruitful land into salty wasteland, because of the wickedness of its inhabitants.
107.35: He turns a desert into a pool, dry land into springs.
107.36: He causes the hungry to settle there, and they establish a city where they can live.
107.37: They sow fields and plant vineyards that yield a fruitful harvest.
107.38: He blesses them, and they multiply greatly; he does not let their livestock decrease.
107.39: When they are diminished and are humbled by cruel oppression and sorrow,
107.40: he pours contempt on nobles and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.
107.41: But he lifts the needy out of their suffering and makes their families multiply like flocks.
107.42: The upright see it and rejoice, and all injustice shuts its mouth.
107.43: Let whoever is wise pay attention to these things and consider the LORD’s acts of faithful love.

108.1: A song. A psalm of David. My heart is confident, God; I will sing; I will sing praises with the whole of my being.
108.2: Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.
108.3: I will praise you, LORD, among the peoples; I will sing praises to you among the nations.
108.4: For your faithful love is higher than the heavens, and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
108.5: God, be exalted above the heavens, and let your glory be over the whole earth.
108.6: Save with your right hand and answer me so that those you love may be rescued.
108.7: God has spoken in his sanctuary: “I will celebrate! I will divide up Shechem. I will apportion the Valley of Succoth.
108.8: Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.
108.9: Moab is my washbasin; I throw my sandal on Edom. I shout in triumph over Philistia.”
108.10: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
108.11: God, haven’t you rejected us? God, you do not march out with our armies.
108.12: Give us aid against the foe, for human help is worthless.
108.13: With God we will perform valiantly; he will trample our foes.

109.1: For the choir director. A psalm of David. God of my praise, do not be silent.
109.2: For wicked and deceitful mouths open against me; they speak against me with lying tongues.
109.3: They surround me with hateful words and attack me without cause.
109.4: In return for my love they accuse me, but I continue to pray.
109.5: They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
109.6: Set a wicked person over him; let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.7: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and let his prayer be counted as sin.
109.8: Let his days be few; let another take over his position.
109.9: Let his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
109.10: Let his children wander as beggars, searching for food far from their demolished homes.
109.11: Let a creditor seize all he has; let strangers plunder what he has worked for.
109.12: Let no one show him kindness, and let no one be gracious to his fatherless children.
109.13: Let the line of his descendants be cut off; let their name be blotted out in the next generation.
109.14: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, and do not let his mother’s sin be blotted out.
109.15: Let their sins always remain before the LORD, and let him remove all memory of them from the earth.
109.16: For he did not think to show kindness, but pursued the suffering, needy, and brokenhearted in order to put them to death.
109.17: He loved cursing—let it fall on him; he took no delight in blessing—let it be far from him.
109.18: He wore cursing like his coat — let it enter his body like water and go into his bones like oil.
109.19: Let it be like a robe he wraps around himself, like a belt he always wears.
109.20: Let this be the LORD’s payment to my accusers, to those who speak evil against me.
109.21: But you, LORD, my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name’s sake; because your faithful love is good, rescue me.
109.22: For I am suffering and needy; my heart is wounded within me.
109.23: I fade away like a lengthening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.
109.24: My knees are weak from fasting, and my body is emaciated.
109.25: I have become an object of ridicule to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads in scorn.
109.26: Help me, LORD my God; save me according to your faithful love
109.27: so they may know that this is your hand and that you, LORD, have done it.
109.28: Though they curse, you will bless. When they rise up, they will be put to shame, but your servant will rejoice.
109.29: My accusers will be clothed with disgrace; they will wear their shame like a cloak.
109.30: I will fervently thank the LORD with my mouth; I will praise him in the presence of many.
109.31: For he stands at the right hand of the needy to save him from those who would condemn him.

110.1: A psalm of David. This is the declaration of the LORD to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.”
110.2: The LORD will extend your mighty scepter from Zion. Rule over your surrounding enemies.
110.3: Your people will volunteer on your day of battle. In holy splendor, from the womb of the dawn, the dew of your youth belongs to you.
110.4: The LORD has sworn an oath and will not take it back: “You are a priest forever according to the pattern of Melchizedek.”
110.5: The Lord is at your right hand; he will crush kings on the day of his anger.
110.6: He will judge the nations, heaping up corpses; he will crush leaders over the entire world.
110.7: He will drink from the brook by the road; therefore, he will lift up his head.

111.1: Hallelujah! I will praise the LORD with all my heart in the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
111.2: The LORD’s works are great, studied by all who delight in them.
111.3: All that he does is splendid and majestic; his righteousness endures forever.
111.4: He has caused his wondrous works to be remembered. The LORD is gracious and compassionate.
111.5: He has provided food for those who fear him; he remembers his covenant forever.
111.6: He has shown his people the power of his works by giving them the inheritance of the nations.
111.7: The works of his hands are truth and justice; all his instructions are trustworthy.
111.8: They are established forever and ever, enacted in truth and in uprightness.
111.9: He has sent redemption to his people. He has ordained his covenant forever. His name is holy and awe-inspiring.
111.10: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow his instructions have good insight. His praise endures forever.

112.1: Hallelujah! Happy is the person who fears the LORD, taking great delight in his commands.
112.2: His descendants will be powerful in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
112.3: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
112.4: Light shines in the darkness for the upright. He is gracious, compassionate, and righteous.
112.5: Good will come to the one who lends generously and conducts his business fairly.
112.6: He will never be shaken. The righteous one will be remembered forever.
112.7: He will not fear bad news; his heart is confident, trusting in the LORD.
112.8: His heart is assured; he will not fear. In the end he will look in triumph on his foes.
112.9: He distributes freely to the poor; his righteousness endures forever. His horn will be exalted in honor.
112.10: The wicked one will see it and be angry; he will gnash his teeth in despair. The desire of the wicked leads to ruin.

113.1: Hallelujah! Give praise, servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.
113.2: Let the name of the LORD be blessed both now and forever.
113.3: From the rising of the sun to its setting, let the name of the LORD be praised.
113.4: The LORD is exalted above all the nations, his glory above the heavens.
113.5: Who is like the LORD our God — the one enthroned on high,
113.6: who stoops down to look on the heavens and the earth?
113.7: He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the trash heap
113.8: in order to seat them with nobles — with the nobles of his people.
113.9: He gives the childless woman a household, making her the joyful mother of children. Hallelujah!

114.1: When Israel came out of Egypt — the house of Jacob from a people who spoke a foreign language —
114.2: Judah became his sanctuary, Israel, his dominion.
114.3: The sea looked and fled; the Jordan turned back.
114.4: The mountains skipped like rams, the hills, like lambs.
114.5: Why was it, sea, that you fled? Jordan, that you turned back?
114.6: Mountains, that you skipped like rams? Hills, like lambs?
114.7: Tremble, earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114.8: who turned the rock into a pool, the flint into a spring.

115.1: Not to us, LORD, not to us, but to your name give glory because of your faithful love, because of your truth.
115.2: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God? ”
115.3: Our God is in heaven and does whatever he pleases.
115.4: Their idols are silver and gold, made by human hands.
115.5: They have mouths but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see.
115.6: They have ears but cannot hear, noses, but cannot smell.
115.7: They have hands but cannot feel, feet, but cannot walk. They cannot make a sound with their throats.
115.8: Those who make them are just like them, as are all who trust in them.
115.9: Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
115.10: House of Aaron, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
115.11: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
115.12: The LORD remembers us and will bless us. He will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron;
115.13: he will bless those who fear the LORD — small and great alike.
115.14: May the LORD add to your numbers, both yours and your children’s.
115.15: May you be blessed by the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
115.16: The heavens are the LORD’s, but the earth he has given to the human race.
115.17: It is not the dead who praise the LORD, nor any of those descending into the silence of death.
115.18: But we will bless the LORD, both now and forever. Hallelujah!

116.1: I love the LORD because he has heard my appeal for mercy.
116.2: Because he has turned his ear to me, I will call out to him as long as I live.
116.3: The ropes of death were wrapped around me, and the torments of Sheol overcame me; I encountered trouble and sorrow.
116.4: Then I called on the name of the LORD: “LORD, save me! ”
116.5: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is compassionate.
116.6: The LORD guards the inexperienced; I was helpless, and he saved me.
116.7: Return to your rest, my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.
116.8: For you, LORD, rescued me from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
116.9: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
116.10: I believed, even when I said, “I am severely oppressed.”
116.12: How can I repay the LORD for all the good he has done for me?
116.13: I will take the cup of salvation and call on the name of the LORD.
116.14: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people.
116.15: The death of his faithful ones is valuable in the LORD’s sight.
116.16: LORD, I am indeed your servant; I am your servant, the son of your female servant. You have loosened my bonds.
116.17: I will offer you a thanksgiving sacrifice and call on the name of the LORD.
116.18: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all his people,
116.19: in the courts of the LORD’s house — within you, Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

117.1: Praise the LORD, all nations! Glorify him, all peoples!
117.2: For his faithful love to us is great; the LORD’s faithfulness endures forever. Hallelujah!

118.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his faithful love endures forever.
118.2: Let Israel say, “His faithful love endures forever.”
118.3: Let the house of Aaron say, “His faithful love endures forever.”
118.4: Let those who fear the LORD say, “His faithful love endures forever.”
118.5: I called to the LORD in distress; the LORD answered me and put me in a spacious place.
118.6: The LORD is for me; I will not be afraid. What can a mere mortal do to me?
118.7: The LORD is my helper; therefore, I will look in triumph on those who hate me.
118.8: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in humanity.
118.9: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in nobles.
118.10: All the nations surrounded me; in the name of the LORD I destroyed them.
118.11: They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me; in the name of the LORD I destroyed them.
118.12: They surrounded me like bees; they were extinguished like a fire among thorns; in the name of the LORD I destroyed them.
118.13: They pushed me hard to make me fall, but the LORD helped me.
118.14: The LORD is my strength and my song; he has become my salvation.
118.15: There are shouts of joy and victory in the tents of the righteous: “The LORD’s right hand performs valiantly!
118.16: The LORD’s right hand is raised. The LORD’s right hand performs valiantly! ”
118.17: I will not die, but I will live and proclaim what the LORD has done.
118.18: The LORD disciplined me severely but did not give me over to death.
118.19: Open the gates of righteousness for me; I will enter through them and give thanks to the LORD.
118.20: This is the LORD’s gate; the righteous will enter through it.
118.21: I will give thanks to you because you have answered me and have become my salvation.
118.22: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
118.23: This came from the LORD; it is wondrous in our sight.
118.24: This is the day the LORD has made; let’s rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25: LORD, save us! LORD, please grant us success!
118.26: He who comes in the name of the LORD is blessed. From the house of the LORD we bless you.
118.27: The LORD is God and has given us light. Bind the festival sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.
118.28: You are my God, and I will give you thanks. You are my God; I will exalt you.
118.29: Give thanks to the LORD, for he is good; his faithful love endures forever.

119.1: How happy are those whose way is blameless, who walk according to the LORD’s instruction!
119.2: Happy are those who keep his decrees and seek him with all their heart.
119.3: They do nothing wrong; they walk in his ways.
119.4: You have commanded that your precepts be diligently kept.
119.5: If only my ways were committed to keeping your statutes!
119.6: Then I would not be ashamed when I think about all your commands.
119.7: I will praise you with an upright heart when I learn your righteous judgments.
119.8: I will keep your statutes; never abandon me.
119.9: How can a young man keep his way pure? By keeping your word.
119.10: I have sought you with all my heart; don’t let me wander from your commands.
119.11: I have treasured your word in my heart so that I may not sin against you.
119.12: LORD, may you be blessed; teach me your statutes.
119.13: With my lips I proclaim all the judgments from your mouth.
119.14: I rejoice in the way revealed by your decrees as much as in all riches.
119.15: I will meditate on your precepts and think about your ways.
119.16: I will delight in your statutes; I will not forget your word.
119.17: Deal generously with your servant so that I might live; then I will keep your word.
119.18: Open my eyes so that I may contemplate wondrous things from your instruction.
119.19: I am a resident alien on earth; do not hide your commands from me.
119.20: I am continually overcome with longing for your judgments.
119.21: You rebuke the arrogant, the ones under a curse, who wander from your commands.
119.22: Take insult and contempt away from me, for I have kept your decrees.
119.23: Though princes sit together speaking against me, your servant will think about your statutes;
119.24: your decrees are my delight and my counselors.
119.25: My life is down in the dust; give me life through your word.
119.26: I told you about my life, and you answered me; teach me your statutes.
119.27: Help me understand the meaning of your precepts so that I can meditate on your wonders.
119.28: I am weary from grief; strengthen me through your word.
119.29: Keep me from the way of deceit and graciously give me your instruction.
119.30: I have chosen the way of truth; I have set your ordinances before me.
119.31: I cling to your decrees; LORD, do not put me to shame.
119.32: I pursue the way of your commands, for you broaden my understanding.
119.33: Teach me, LORD, the meaning of your statutes, and I will always keep them.
119.34: Help me understand your instruction, and I will obey it and follow it with all my heart.
119.35: Help me stay on the path of your commands, for I take pleasure in it.
119.36: Turn my heart to your decrees and not to dishonest profit.
119.37: Turn my eyes from looking at what is worthless; give me life in your ways.
119.38: Confirm what you said to your servant, for it produces reverence for you.
119.39: Turn away the disgrace I dread; indeed, your judgments are good.
119.40: How I long for your precepts! Give me life through your righteousness.
119.41: Let your faithful love come to me, LORD, your salvation, as you promised.
119.42: Then I can answer the one who taunts me, for I trust in your word.
119.43: Never take the word of truth from my mouth, for I hope in your judgments.
119.44: I will always obey your instruction, forever and ever.
119.45: I will walk freely in an open place because I study your precepts.
119.46: I will speak of your decrees before kings and not be ashamed.
119.47: I delight in your commands, which I love.
119.48: I will lift up my hands to your commands, which I love, and will meditate on your statutes.
119.49: Remember your word to your servant; you have given me hope through it.
119.50: This is my comfort in my affliction: Your promise has given me life.
119.51: The arrogant constantly ridicule me, but I do not turn away from your instruction.
119.52: LORD, I remember your judgments from long ago and find comfort.
119.53: Fury seizes me because of the wicked who reject your instruction.
119.54: Your statutes are the theme of my song during my earthly life.
119.55: LORD, I remember your name in the night, and I obey your instruction.
119.56: This is my practice: I obey your precepts.
119.57: The LORD is my portion; I have promised to keep your words.
119.58: I have sought your favor with all my heart; be gracious to me according to your promise.
119.59: I thought about my ways and turned my steps back to your decrees.
119.60: I hurried, not hesitating to keep your commands.
119.61: Though the ropes of the wicked were wrapped around me, I did not forget your instruction.
119.62: I rise at midnight to thank you for your righteous judgments.
119.63: I am a friend to all who fear you, to those who keep your precepts.
119.64: LORD, the earth is filled with your faithful love; teach me your statutes.
119.65: LORD, you have treated your servant well, just as you promised.
119.66: Teach me good judgment and discernment, for I rely on your commands.
119.67: Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I keep your word.
119.68: You are good, and you do what is good; teach me your statutes.
119.69: The arrogant have smeared me with lies, but I obey your precepts with all my heart.
119.70: Their hearts are hard and insensitive, but I delight in your instruction.
119.71: It was good for me to be afflicted so that I could learn your statutes.
119.72: Instruction from your lips is better for me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
119.73: Your hands made me and formed me; give me understanding so that I can learn your commands.
119.74: Those who fear you will see me and rejoice, for I put my hope in your word.
119.75: I know, LORD, that your judgments are just and that you have afflicted me fairly.
119.76: May your faithful love comfort me as you promised your servant.
119.77: May your compassion come to me so that I may live, for your instruction is my delight.
119.78: Let the arrogant be put to shame for slandering me with lies; I will meditate on your precepts.
119.79: Let those who fear you, those who know your decrees, turn to me.
119.80: May my heart be blameless regarding your statutes so that I will not be put to shame.
119.81: I long for your salvation; I put my hope in your word.
119.82: My eyes grow weary looking for what you have promised; I ask, “When will you comfort me? ”
119.83: Though I have become like a wineskin dried by smoke, I do not forget your statutes.
119.84: How many days must your servant wait? When will you execute judgment on my persecutors?
119.85: The arrogant have dug pits for me; they violate your instruction.
119.86: All your commands are true; people persecute me with lies—help me!
119.87: They almost ended my life on earth, but I did not abandon your precepts.
119.88: Give me life in accordance with your faithful love, and I will obey the decree you have spoken.
119.89: LORD, your word is forever; it is firmly fixed in heaven.
119.90: Your faithfulness is for all generations; you established the earth, and it stands firm.
119.91: Your judgments stand firm today, for all things are your servants.
119.92: If your instruction had not been my delight, I would have died in my affliction.
119.93: I will never forget your precepts, for you have given me life through them.
119.94: I am yours; save me, for I have studied your precepts.
119.95: The wicked hope to destroy me, but I contemplate your decrees.
119.96: I have seen a limit to all perfection, but your command is without limit.
119.97: How I love your instruction! It is my meditation all day long.
119.98: Your command makes me wiser than my enemies, for it is always with me.
119.99: I have more insight than all my teachers because your decrees are my meditation.
119.100: I understand more than the elders because I obey your precepts.
119.101: I have kept my feet from every evil path to follow your word.
119.102: I have not turned from your judgments, for you yourself have instructed me.
119.103: How sweet your word is to my taste — sweeter than honey in my mouth.
119.104: I gain understanding from your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.
119.105: Your word is a lamp for my feet and a light on my path.
119.106: I have solemnly sworn to keep your righteous judgments.
119.107: I am severely afflicted; LORD, give me life according to your word.
119.108: LORD, please accept my freewill offerings of praise, and teach me your judgments.
119.109: My life is constantly in danger, yet I do not forget your instruction.
119.110: The wicked have set a trap for me, but I have not wandered from your precepts.
119.111: I have your decrees as a heritage forever; indeed, they are the joy of my heart.
119.112: I am resolved to obey your statutes to the very end.
119.113: I hate those who are double-minded, but I love your instruction.
119.114: You are my shelter and my shield; I put my hope in your word.
119.115: Depart from me, you evil ones, so that I may obey my God’s commands.
119.116: Sustain me as you promised, and I will live; do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
119.117: Sustain me so that I can be safe and always be concerned about your statutes.
119.118: You reject all who stray from your statutes, for their deceit is a lie.
119.119: You remove all the wicked on earth as if they were dross from metal; therefore, I love your decrees.
119.120: I tremble in awe of you; I fear your judgments.
119.121: I have done what is just and right; do not leave me to my oppressors.
119.122: Guarantee your servant’s well-being; do not let the arrogant oppress me.
119.123: My eyes grow weary looking for your salvation and for your righteous promise.
119.124: Deal with your servant based on your faithful love; teach me your statutes.
119.125: I am your servant; give me understanding so that I may know your decrees.
119.126: It is time for the LORD to act, for they have violated your instruction.
119.127: Since I love your commands more than gold, even the purest gold,
119.128: I carefully follow all your precepts and hate every false way.
119.129: Your decrees are wondrous; therefore I obey them.
119.130: The revelation of your words brings light and gives understanding to the inexperienced.
119.131: I open my mouth and pant because I long for your commands.
119.132: Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is your practice toward those who love your name.
119.133: Make my steps steady through your promise; don’t let any sin dominate me.
119.134: Redeem me from human oppression, and I will keep your precepts.
119.135: Make your face shine on your servant, and teach me your statutes.
119.136: My eyes pour out streams of tears because people do not follow your instruction.
119.137: You are righteous, LORD, and your judgments are just.
119.138: The decrees you issue are righteous and altogether trustworthy.
119.139: My anger overwhelms me because my foes forget your words.
119.140: Your word is completely pure, and your servant loves it.
119.141: I am insignificant and despised, but I do not forget your precepts.
119.142: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and your instruction is true.
119.143: Trouble and distress have overtaken me, but your commands are my delight.
119.144: Your decrees are righteous forever. Give me understanding, and I will live.
119.145: I call with all my heart; answer me, LORD. I will obey your statutes.
119.146: I call to you; save me, and I will keep your decrees.
119.147: I rise before dawn and cry out for help; I put my hope in your word.
119.148: I am awake through each watch of the night to meditate on your promise.
119.149: In keeping with your faithful love, hear my voice. LORD, give me life in keeping with your justice.
119.150: Those who pursue evil plans come near; they are far from your instruction.
119.151: You are near, LORD, and all your commands are true.
119.152: Long ago I learned from your decrees that you have established them forever.
119.153: Consider my affliction and rescue me, for I have not forgotten your instruction.
119.154: Champion my cause and redeem me; give me life as you promised.
119.155: Salvation is far from the wicked because they do not study your statutes.
119.156: Your compassions are many, LORD; give me life according to your judgments.
119.157: My persecutors and foes are many. I have not turned from your decrees.
119.158: I have seen the disloyal and feel disgust because they do not keep your word.
119.159: Consider how I love your precepts; LORD, give me life according to your faithful love.
119.160: The entirety of your word is truth, each of your righteous judgments endures forever.
119.161: Princes have persecuted me without cause, but my heart fears only your word.
119.162: I rejoice over your promise like one who finds vast treasure.
119.163: I hate and abhor falsehood, but I love your instruction.
119.164: I praise you seven times a day for your righteous judgments.
119.165: Abundant peace belongs to those who love Your law; nothing makes them stumble.
119.166: LORD, I hope for your salvation and carry out your commands.
119.167: I obey your decrees and love them greatly.
119.168: I obey your precepts and decrees, for all my ways are before you.
119.169: Let my cry reach you, LORD; give me understanding according to your word.
119.170: Let my plea reach you; rescue me according to your promise.
119.171: My lips pour out praise, for you teach me your statutes.
119.172: My tongue sings about your promise, for all your commands are righteous.
119.173: May your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen your precepts.
119.174: I long for your salvation, LORD, and your instruction is my delight.
119.175: Let me live, and I will praise you; may your judgments help me.
119.176: I wander like a lost sheep; seek your servant, for I do not forget your commands.

120.1: A song of ascents. In my distress I called to the LORD, and he answered me.
120.2: “LORD, rescue me from lying lips and a deceitful tongue.”
120.3: What will he give you, and what will he do to you, you deceitful tongue?
120.4: A warrior’s sharp arrows with burning charcoal!
120.5: What misery that I have stayed in Meshech, that I have lived among the tents of Kedar!
120.6: I have dwelt too long with those who hate peace.
120.7: I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.

121.1: A song of ascents. I lift my eyes toward the mountains. Where will my help come from?
121.2: My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
121.3: He will not allow your foot to slip; your Protector will not slumber.
121.4: Indeed, the Protector of Israel does not slumber or sleep.
121.5: The LORD protects you; the LORD is a shelter right by your side.
121.6: The sun will not strike you by day or the moon by night.
121.7: The LORD will protect you from all harm; he will protect your life.
121.8: The LORD will protect your coming and going both now and forever.

122.1: A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced with those who said to me, “Let’s go to the house of the LORD.”
122.2: Our feet were standing within your gates, Jerusalem —
122.3: Jerusalem, built as a city should be, solidly united,
122.4: where the tribes, the LORD’s tribes, go up to give thanks to the name of the LORD. (This is an ordinance for Israel. )
122.5: There, thrones for judgment are placed, thrones of the house of David.
122.6: Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem: “May those who love you be secure;
